addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

27 Junij
1592.
M
r
Bodeleie to my L.
By
e Latsgraves Ambassado
r
./

page.lettertext:
fol.54r
May it please yo
r
good L. The bearer
heerof is
e
Baron of Winningbergh
, who is
sent in Ambassade from
e
Electo
r
Palatine
to her
Ma
tie
.
Of his, and of
e rest of his
company, I have signified in a former. But
this I doe write to satisfie
e Baron, who
req
e
steth my letter: and to desire of yo
r
L.
in his behalf,
at if there be any ceremonies
to be used in
e redeliverie of
e garter,
it would please yo
w
to addresse some suche
unto him, as may instruct him in
e order.
For heere he hath bin heard, and also interte-
ned w
t
speciall respect.
And thus I take
my humble leave. Fr
o
e Hage 27 1592
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
